AlgosLinkedList¶

public class AlgosLinkedList<E> extends AbstractSequentialList<E>¶

Custom implementation of a linked list that doesn’t allow for null elements or duplicate elements as defined by the equals() method.

Author:

jhnguye4
Parameters:
  • <E> – the object that will be passed through the linked list

Constructors¶

AlgosLinkedList¶

public AlgosLinkedList()¶

Constructor for the LinkedList that instantiates two null nodes for the front and the back and then makes front.next point to the back and the back.prev point to the front.

Methods¶

add¶

public void add(int index, E element)¶

This method adds an element to the LinkedList

Parameters:
  • index – is the position where the new element will be placed
  • element – is the data or object that will be stored in that link

listIterator¶

public ListIterator<E> listIterator(int index)¶

This method returns a LinkedListIterator with the index it will go to

Parameters:
  • index – is the position that the iterator will move to
Returns:

a new LinkedListIterator object

set¶

public E set(int index, E element)¶

This method sets the element at the specified index

Parameters:
  • index – is the position where the new element will be placed
  • element – is the data or object that will be stored in that link
Returns:

E is the object that is being replaced

size¶

public int size()¶

This method returns the size of the linked list

Returns:size is how big the linked list is
